timeline.message:
Change model store reference to pytorch.org url

In conjunction with PR 696, I've updated all code/doc reference to the existing S3 bucket to point to the torchserve.pytorch.org URL.

timeline.bodyText: @jeremiahschung Please verify you have run tests for this check in actual torchserve deployment and verified that models from the model zoo with the new URLs can be downloaded and used in torchserve
timeline.author: chauhang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -221,9 +221,9 @@ the backend workers convert "Bytearray to utf-8 string" when the Content-Type of
 * `max_request_size` : The maximum allowable request size that the Torchserve accepts, in bytes. Default: 6553500
 * `max_response_size` : The maximum allowable response size that the Torchserve sends, in bytes. Default: 6553500
 * `allowed_urls` : Comma separated regex of allowed source URL(s) from where models can be registered. Default: "file://.*|http(s)?://.*" (all URLs and local file system)
-eg : To allow base URLs "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" and "https://torchserve.s3.amazonaws.com/" use following regex string
+eg : To allow base URLs "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" and "https://torchserve.pytorch.org/" use following regex string
 ```
-allowed_urls=https://s3.amazonaws.com/.*,https://torchserve.s3.amazonaws.com/.*
+allowed_urls=https://s3.amazonaws.com/.*,https://torchserve.pytorch.org/.*

replies.bodyText: Tested the allowed_urls option and attached log in the PR description. Also updated with regression test log results which call into the management API utilizing the new URLs. Also added EKS standup test results.
replies.author: jeremiahschung
